definition: to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: I am a talented worrier, too.
sentences.chinese: 但我也是個才氣橫溢的愛發愁的人。

sentences.english: He is worrying about his gambling debts.
Today he does not have to worry about making a living.
sentences.chinese: 現在他不用爲生活發愁了。

sentences.english: Fret not, as we've got a whole 'nother round of laughs coming your way.
sentences.chinese: 別發愁了，我們爲您帶來了一款全新的有趣玩意兒。

sentences.english: She would have been sad, if sadness had been possible to her.
sentences.chinese: 如果她有可能愁悶的話，她會發愁的。

sentences.english: We've decided that it's no use to worry, Dinny.
sentences.chinese: 我們已認定發愁是沒用的，丁尼。

sentences.english: He took a powder and left his mother to worry about his gambling debts.
sentences.chinese: 他一走了之，而讓他的母親爲他的賭債發愁。

sentences.english: Catherine: No, I am just worrying about it. Do you have any idea?
sentences.chinese: 沒有啊。我正爲此事發愁呢。你有什麼辦法嗎？

sentences.english: As kids, my friends and I never bothered with plans.
sentences.chinese: 在我的孩提時代，我和我的朋友從不爲計劃發愁。

sentences.english: If you’re anything like me you’ll agonize over what to write in the cards.
sentences.chinese: 你可能也像我一樣發愁賀卡里該寫些什麼。

sentences.english: I'll not worry about it. I'll let nature take its course.
sentences.chinese: 我不再爲此事發愁了，順其自然吧。

sentences.english: All his cares and anxieties make him look quite old.
sentences.chinese: 他心事重重，擔憂發愁，使他看上去老多了。

sentences.english: There is no need to worry over such a side-issue.
sentences.chinese: 沒有必要爲這樣的枝節問題發愁了。

sentences.english: No, I am just worrying about it. Do you have any idea?
sentences.chinese: 沒有啊。我正爲此事發愁呢。你有什麼辦法嗎？

sentences.english: There are many places in the world where people are afflicted by starvation.
sentences.chinese: 世界上的很多地方，人們仍舊在爲喫不飽而發愁。

sentences.english: Seems lak to me I jes can't help but sigh.
sentences.chinese: 似乎對我就只能嘆息發愁。

definition: to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
to live one's life/to make a living
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
